body_html:
@peterjc123 with regards to my previous post

I solved some missing dlls by adding the directories to the PATH variable. However there are many modules that cannot load because they do not exist in my system:
API-MS-WIN-XXXX.DLL
ext-ms-win-XXXX.dll

KERNEL32 seems to have itself as a dependency

The function that python35.dll has problems exporting is " PyThreadState_UncheckedGet"

These DLLs seem to be the ones giving me problems. The rest of the modules marked in red seem to be able to run without problem (only python35 and kernel32 have issues running).

I'm not to sure on how to detect a circular dependency.

body:
@peterjc123 with regards to my previous post 

I solved some missing dlls by adding the directories to the PATH variable. However there are many modules that cannot load because they do not exist in my system:
API-MS-WIN-XXXX.DLL
ext-ms-win-XXXX.dll

KERNEL32 seems to have itself as a dependency

The function that python35.dll has problems exporting is " PyThreadState_UncheckedGet"

These DLLs seem to be the ones giving me problems. The rest of the modules marked in red seem to be able to run without problem (only python35 and kernel32 have issues running).

I'm not to sure on how to detect a circular dependency.
